There are no details stored on your slip at this time.
The slip can not be worn.
Analysis of a bungalow design slip indicates the creator has provided the following information:
A bungalow design slip is a private property attunement certificate that can be used to obtain alters for your private property items.
This slip is not yet attuned to any object.
USAGE:
- CLEAN: Remove an attunement from the slip.  This cannot be done once your request has been submitted.
- POINT: Apply an approved alteration to an attuned object in your private property.
- READ: See the recorded details for your slip.
- WAVE: Wave at an object in your private property to attune this slip to it.
- WHISPER {slip} {BASE}: Add your base alteration request to the slip
- WHISPER {slip} {SHOW}: Add your show alteration request to the slip
* When you are ready to submit your request, you can submit it through the Premium Alter system, if applicable, or you can hand this slip to a live merchant.
The design slip will cost 15,000,000 coins.
details.material: organic material, an extremely common material

Please remember you must be able to cast this spell on your own in order to use the customization and that this emerald iguana arm does not grant you the spell.

Appendage 3: some scaly mottled brown iguana arms
Important note:
The effect of this token is cosmetic.  It does not increase the effect or damage caused by a spell.

This item does NOT grant spell knowledge.  REDEEMing this item assumes that the player already has the ability to cast the customized spell either from an item, Spell Knowledge, or having the spell cast upon you, if applicable.
The emerald iguana arm will cost 500,000 coins.

items.name: a lopsided breastplate crafted from a pair of fused steel signs

raw: Much of this lopsided breastplate appears to have been cobbled together from spare bits of scrap metal.  The main body of the armor is composed of two steel signs that have been molded into the general shape of a torso and fused together.  It's just possible to make out faded painted advertisements on the metal; the front bears the chipped bold wording of "... amazing!", while the back has the crude image of an overflowing beer mug.  It has a small enchanter's glyph.  An ethereal necrotic film covers the breastplate.
The breastplate is plate armor that covers the torso only.

items.name: a silver-accented white monir water cannon

raw: The monir water cannon is constructed of lightweight wood with a wide silver tube which runs down its center.  A small silver lever is mounted on one side and a small bellows pump on the other.  A large inflatable bladder, which is currently inflated and empty, is attached at the rear of the cannon and connected to the tube by a silver ring.  A small, spring-loaded valve covers the opposite end of the tube where it can be secured closed by a small catch.  The valve is currently closed.
The cannon can not be worn.
The monir water cannon will cost 4,500,000 coins.

items.name: a small berobed rhimar ice wizard with wide frost opal eyes

raw: Wrought from high quality rhimar, the ice wizard has been hammered into a slightly rotund shape.  Thin sheets of blue-white steel form the tiny figure's billowing robes and pointed hat.  Exaggerated eyebrows sit atop the wizard's frost opal eyes.
The rhimar ice wizard is holding no gem, and there is no pattern set in the slot in its back.
It is estimated that a small berobed rhimar ice wizard with wide frost opal eyes can store a very small amount with enough space for a couple of items.
The wizard can not be worn.
Analysis of a small berobed rhimar ice wizard with wide frost opal eyes indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This item may be altered under the following conditions: the gemcutter's form must be something humanoid with a back, a head, and an appendage that can hold something, like a hand, a claw, or paw.  It must be made of metal.
The gemcutter can have both a long and a show.
Only certain patterns made specifically for gemcutters can be used with this item.

Analysis of a fuzzy ivory knit hat indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This Veola item is designed to display a gem, feather, flower, insects and sea creatures, pointed items, or other miscellaneous items.  Miscellany includes other foraged items, skins, shells, and other larger non-gem treasure items.  The hat has several distinct descriptions, depending on what item is inserted.  To insert an item, hold the hat in one hand, the item you'd like to insert in the opposite hand, and PUSH hat.  PULLing the hat will remove the item and restore the hat to its empty description.  It has never been unlocked, but it could be by a qualified merchant.

When worn, it will temporarily alter your hairstyle and supports up to three custom hairstyles in addition to the default setting.  To change between the available hairstyles, hold the item in your hands and TURN it.  Currently it has the following custom hairstyles:
<hair> carelessly piled into a fuzzy ivory knit hat with loosened strands wisping around his face
<hair> that haphazardly falls about his and is barely contained by a fuzzy ivory knit hat<
<hair> tumbled over one shoulder underneath a fuzzy ivory knit hat
<hair> and a fuzzy ivory knit hat worn at a rakish angle (default)

When altering these items there is some important information to keep in mind.  First, this item belongs to the HAT group and may only be altered in one of the following nouns without changing the group: Hat, Cap, Tricorn, Tricorne, and Capotain. Welcome to the one of a kind, the uniquely crafted, and never duplicated Ribbonator Hair Ribbon.

items.name: some long skirts of layered linen and strings of bone beads

raw: Analysis of some long skirts of layered linen and strings of bone beads indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~Bone Shaman Clothing~
Bone-adorned shamanistic clothing with customizable adornments.
This clothing can work in tandem with Bone Shaman Cloaks, but they also work well on their own.
Alterations to this are fine as long as you heed the restrictions below.
~Restrictions~
* Item MUST indicate it is decorated with some sort of bone in the 15/15/15, long or show.
* Bone adornment CAN be:
- Bones/bone fragments
- Claws/talons
- Teeth/fangs
- Beaks
- Skulls (small)
- Horn/antler pieces
* Bone adornment can NOT be:
- Specific to a race (NO elven finger bones, for example)
- An entire skeleton
- Large bones/skulls
* Currently works with ONLY:
- Leg-worn [skirts, pants, etc.]
- Torso-worn (robes, dresses, shirts, etc.)
- Front-worn (bodices, vests, tabards, etc.)
~Item Information~
This item is setup for skirt/kilt messaging.

This is the Racial Ferroniere that was first released in 5108 as part of the cultural and racial carts that wandered Mist Harbor.  It can only ever be altered into the following:
Aemikvai   - Giant          - The stone is always carved with a Saramar rune, and the setting is intricate knotwork.
Basrenne   - Forest Gnome   - Chain of woven or linked reeds which can be dyed. Gem is in its mostly natural state.
Elothrai   - Erithi         - Always uses an agate or an agita for the gem.
Ferrigem   - Burghal Gnome  - Chain uses bits and pieces of different metals, gem is in slivers or a shard, and a tiny gear or gadget is worked in somewhere.
Geldaralad - Elves          - Requires a twisted vaalin chain.
Khazurka   - Dwarf          - Mithril chain, cut gem, often very detailed.
Seer-stone - Human          - Oval-cut stone turned lengthwise to resemble a third eye.
Trinette   - Halfling       - Tri-stranded chain, trilliant-cut gem, and an elaborate setting.
For more information on the details of Ferroniere's you can go to:
https://gswiki.play.net/Ferroniere
Alter Instructions:
Please make sure that you remove the gemstone before giving this to an alterer to customize for you.
Please adhere to the rules above regarding this item.

Analysis of a pale cire silk chemise indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Illegal Alteration Clothing Line (IACLs) ~*~

This item can have different descriptions when held and worn.  Wait!  What??  That's right, you can now have a tight bodice, low-rise pants, or maybe a long cloak that actually drags on the ground.  Keep in mind that normal alteration rules may still apply based on merchant personalities and general good taste.
Verbs:  ATTEND, REMOVE, RUB and WEAR
Alteration Guidelines:
* You can have a base, long, and show
* Base:  the same for both worn and unworn
* Long:  not required for unworn (unless you want a show) but required for worn
* Show:  not required, but if you have it, it will be the same for worn and unworn, and you will need a long for unworn too
* DISALLOWED:  Anything that references exposed skin is not allowed (so no shoulder-baring shirts or tight pants revealing a toned abdomen, for example)
* Overly Risque Items:  This script is not meant to get around any policies on overly risque items.  The merchant has final say on this.
This item has the following worn description:
a pale cire silk chemise fluidly draped across the bust
The pale cire silk chemise will cost 25,000 coins.

items.name: a visibly boned ebon lace corset

raw: Analysis of a visibly boned ebon lace corset indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Illegal Alteration Clothing Line (IACLs) ~*~

This item can have different descriptions when held and worn.  Wait!  What??  That's right, you can now have a tight bodice, low-rise pants, or maybe a long cloak that actually drags on the ground.  Keep in mind that normal alteration rules may still apply based on merchant personalities and general good taste.
Verbs:  ATTEND, REMOVE, RUB and WEAR
Alteration Guidelines:
* You can have a base, long, and show
* Base:  the same for both worn and unworn
* Long:  not required for unworn (unless you want a show) but required for worn
* Show:  not required, but if you have it, it will be the same for worn and unworn, and you will need a long for unworn too
* DISALLOWED:  Anything that references exposed skin is not allowed (so no shoulder-baring shirts or tight pants revealing a toned abdomen, for example)
* Overly Risque Items:  This script is not meant to get around any policies on overly risque items.  The merchant has final say on this.
This item has the following worn description:
an ebon lace corset visibly boned along the contours of the hips
The ebon lace corset will cost 100,000 coins.

raise

1st Person: You lift a small maroon dollhouse toy up to your eye level, and you're certain you see the tiniest shadows skittering about within it.  In the span of a blink, they are out of sight, and you lower the toy.
3rd Person: Brodega lifts a small maroon dollhouse toy up to his eye level and looks perplexed for a moment before lowering it.
hug
1st Person: You draw a small maroon dollhouse toy close to your heart, gripping it tightly, and you are filled with pleasant, albeit slightly manic, memories of childhood delight!
3rd Person: Brodega draws a small maroon dollhouse toy to his heart, gripping it tightly, and his eyes widen and are filled with childlike merriment, if not a tinge of delirium!
poke
1st Person: You roughly and repeatedly poke on the side of a small maroon dollhouse toy with your fingers.  You swear for a brief moment that you hear tiny screams echoing from inside.
3rd Person: Brodega roughly and repeatedly pokes on the side of a small maroon dollhouse toy with his fingers.  He then appears to be listening intently to it.
tilt
1st Person: Gently, you turn a small maroon dollhouse toy back and forth in your hands, and you notice clacking and thudding from inside it as some tiny, delicate furniture tumbles around within.
3rd Person: Gently, Brodega turns a small maroon dollhouse toy back and forth in his hands, and you hear some faint clacking and thudding from within it.
If there is a typo in the above messaging, please ASSIST and request a referral to speak to a GameMaster to fix it.  DO NOT BUG or BUGITEM the toy!
The dollhouse toy will cost 10,000 coins.

Fired to perfection and covered in a light yellow glaze, this yellow clay vase is almost overflowing with moist dirt that appears to shift and change color of its own accord.  Tiny flowers painted with bright enamel decorate the thick, wide rim, and three small holes have been carefully bored into the vase's base.
In the Common language, it reads:
These seeds will produce healing flowers.
It is estimated that a dirt-filled yellow clay vase can store a very small amount with enough space for one item.
The vase can not be worn.
Analysis of a dirt-filled yellow clay vase indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This item must remain dirt/soil-filled, and can be a pot|planter|canister|bucket|vase|can.  You can grow decorative flowers without limitation, and healing flowers 4x/day.
The "Cooking Ingredient" unlock is not active.

These items will wilt/mold/rot and disentegrate after 4 weeks.  The vase is at Tier 2.  (Original merchant: Dawdly Windlebaum)  Your vase currently has the following verbs available:  PINCH, POKE, POUR, PULL, RUB, SHAKE.
The yellow clay vase will cost 1,250,000 coins.
details.material: organic material, an extremely common material

You need only RAISE your voucher while holding a compatible item in your other hand or on your person.
Your voucher may not be altered or changed in any way.
The soil-stained voucher will cost 1,000,000 coins.

raw: A lace-edged silver locket cannot store anything inside of it at all.
Analysis of a lace-edged silver locket indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is the "Unique Feature" version of a portrait locket.  The base of the locket may be altered by a merchant, as well as the picture inside.  Other aspects, however, may not be altered.

To create a portrait of yourself in the locket, simply OPEN it while it is in your right hand.  Once the portrait is made, you cannot alter the picture without the help of a willing merchant.  Bear in mind that this portrait will incorporate your "unique" features, if you have any that are visible when the portrait is made.
You can OPEN and CLOSE the locket.
A small handful of merchants may be able and willing to attune this locket to a beloved.
The silver locket will cost 50,000 coins.
You see the outside of an oval-shaped glaes locket.
There is nothing to read on the outside of the glaes locket.
There is nothing to read on the inside of the glaes locket.
An oval-shaped glaes locket cannot store anything inside of it at all.
Analysis of an oval-shaped glaes locket indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is the "Variable Expression" version of a portrait locket.  The following may be altered by a willing merchant:  the base (15/15/15); a long description; the picture that is visible inside of the locket when it is open; the outside surface (this will always be preceded by the words, "The outside of the locket is"); and the read.  None of these aspects may contradict one another.

To create a portrait of yourself in the locket, simply OPEN it while it is in your right hand.  Once the portrait is made, you cannot alter the picture without the help of a willing merchant.  Bear in mind that when the initial portrait is made of someone using this locket, it will show him or her as a curmudgeon.  Some merchants may be willing to change the initial portrait "personality" (prior to the portrait being taken) for you (options are: curmudgeon, giggly, evil, haughty, joyful/adventurous, flirt, moody, confident, triumphant, happy drunk, peaceful, bookworm, romantic, gambler, vain, daredevil).
Currently you are able to COVER, OPEN, TUCK, and CLOSE the locket.  This locket may be unlocked further by a very small handful of merchants.
A small handful of merchants may be able and willing to attune this locket to a beloved.
The glaes locket will cost 50,000 coins.

This cloak may be altered by a talented merchant, bearing in mind the following guidelines:
(1) The 15/15/15 must be neutral and simple if you have more than one look so that it makes sense for both looks.
(2) The item must remain the same type of item in both looks - a cloak cannot turn into a jacket just because it is turned inside-out.

Analysis of a series of siren lizard needles indicates this is a scripted piercing jewelry item, where the creator has provided the following information:
Name: Flippable Piercing Jewelry
Specific location: right ear
Displays as: a series of siren lizard needles in the upper ridge of his right ear

Verbs trapped: WEAR/REMOVE, POUR (on), CAST, LOOK/SHOW, PULL, TOUCH, RUB, LICK (for lip only), PUSH.  Also see PIERCE HELP.  You can also FLIP to use the needles in all facial piercing slots (but if the noun/item is singular, it cannot be worn in dual slots).

Merchant Services:  Alterations should ensure that non-flippable items retain a matched noun and pierced slot; all others must have a generalized enough noun to logically sit in ANY eligible piercing slot.  Avoid naming the body part in the base/long (when worn, a description gets added denoting placement).  The specific location and/or singular/plural status CAN be changed by general merchants.  Changing an item from static to flippable or flippable to static is currently only offered by select merchants as a special service.

raw: You'll need to be holding a smoke-like dark vaelfyren mask in order to inspect it.
Analysis of a smoke-like dark vaelfyren mask indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Welcome to the Naidem Mask brought to you by the owners of Filigree and Whorls in Evermore Hollow.
It has access to the following fluffy actions: attend, eat, express, remove, tilt, touch, and wear
When worn, it fits into your features and provides the following messaging:

He is very tall.  It is difficult to determine his age as a smoke-like dark vaelfyren mask covers most of his features, though his golden eyes can be seen in the eye slits.   He has shaven head, ginger hair.
When not worn, you can customize it using the following actions:
EXHALE:  While holding a gemstone, you can either change the body of the mask or dust it with the gemstone.
PUSH:  While holding a ribbon, you can change the ties that bind the mask in place.
TURN:  While holding a foraged item, and if there is filigree, you can change the pattern of the filigree.
TWIST:  While holding a piece of ore, you can create a filigree overlay.

INSPECT:  While holding one of the customizing materials (gemstone, ribbon, foraged item, ore), you can INSPECT the mask to see the results.  This will not consume the item and offers a preview of the change.
Special Notes on Customizing Items:
All items used to modify the mask are consumed when used.

Not all gemstones are created equal.  As such, the following gemstones can never be used in the mask: agita, ambergris, caederine, coral, chrysalis, core, corestone, crescent, cube, egg, eye, fang, pearl, pebble, razern-bloom, riftshard, riftstone, rivertear, rock, plinite, pumice, scarab, shadowglass, shell, shard, soulstone, spiral, sponge, spur, talon, teardrop, thorn, toadstool, tooth, tusk, waterweb, wheel, or wraithaline

Additionally, the following gemstones change the article and adjective of the mask: aranthium-bloom (drops bloom), bismuth, all dusts (drops the word dust), faenor-bloom (drops bloom), mithril-bloom (drops bloom), all nuggets (drops the word nugget), ora-bloom (drops bloom), rhimar-bloom (drops bloom), and vultite-bloom (drops bloom)

The following gemstones transition their adjective to the mask's article, the noun to the mask's adjective: agate, amber, bloodstone, bluerock, bronzite, chalcedony, carbuncle, crysoprase, cinderstone, cordierite, crowstone, feldspar, fragment, geode, goldstone, gypsum, haon, heliotrope, hematite, hyacinth, ivory, jade, jasper, korerupine, labradorite, lapis lazuli, malachite, maoral, marble, maracsite, mekret, melanite, moonstone, mother-of-pearl, mournstone, nephrite, obsidian, oligoclase, onyx, opal, petalite, prehnite, pyrite, roestone, rosepar, rosette, saewehna, sard, sardonyx, scolecite, scoria, serpentine, shale, smoldereye, snowstone, spectrolite, sphene, spherine, stone, thanot, thunderstone, and titanite
Everything else will translate into (a/an) gemstone-adjective gemstone-noun-dusted on the mask.
There is a default setting for the article and adjective of a mask that can be handled by any merchant.  Those settings are:
Custom Article: a smoke-like
Custom Adjective: dark vaelfyren
A smoke-like dark vaelfyren mask is currently Tier 3 of 3.
Clean:  Use this to remove the current design and start over.
The dark vaelfyren mask will cost 5,000,000 coins.

items.name: a skein of spangled labradorite blue maedatha yarn

raw: The yarn can not be worn.
Analysis of a skein of spangled labradorite blue maedatha yarn indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a skein of yarn that can be used to create items using knitting needles.  It will create spangled knitted labradorite blue maedatha items when completed.  There is enough spangled labradorite yarn to knit 60 rows.
Yarn of the same type can be bundled into skeins of up to 100 rows.

You can use certain dyes to change the color, or have the yarn altered by a merchant.  Only the color and material can be changed.  You can also choose a description for the entire knitted garment, such as fluffy or soft.

Acceptable materials are: alpaca, angora, aneula, Aldoran wool, bamboo, bresuna, buckram, cameline, captiql, cavelta, chainsil, chenille, cotton, dagswain, fraelhan, flannel, flax, fleece, gossamer, heather, inytela, jute, krinklevelt, lamb's wool, lambilen, linen, maedatha, malghavan wool, merino wool, mohair, moreen, myssamere, oiremere, oxilen, paeline, pashmina, plumille, qiviut, ramie linen, roltalen, rolton wool, ruhani wool, rackhal, sailcloth, flyrsilk, lotus silk, ramie silk, raw silk, sea silk, spidersilk, starsilk, silk, stoutfoot wool, tartan, tweed, vaslavilen, vicuna, vylith, vylithen, wild silk, woolen, wool, wylten, wynelen, yierkale, and yierka wool.
Using materials outside this list will not work with dyes and may have unexpected results, or not be permifiable.
The labradorite yarn will cost 15,000 coins.

raw: Analysis of a transparent chainsil mask indicates the creator has provided the following information:

A transparent chainsil mask is part of the Ferocious Eyes Series sold at Rumor Woods in the year of 5121.  Once worn, it will change your eye characteristic or color based on the customized selection that you decide upon before wearing it.  Furthermore, the mask will instantly become invisible and give you additional eye-interacting verbs.

It is currently tier 4 out of 4, which grants it 5 customizations.  It has access to the following verbs: attend, flip*, gawk, gaze, glance***, grin, ponder, raise, remove, rub, simper, stare, thump, tilt, touch, turn**, twitch, wear, and wish.
*Cycles through the mask's eye color choices.
**Cycles through the mask's eye characteristic choices.
***Denotes demeanor-based verbs.
Alteration Rules:  You may alter this freely provided you adhere to the rules under the ALTER verb for Feature Alterations.
Current Settings:  He has yellow-striated cornflower blue eyes.
Custom Color 1: cornflower blue
Custom Color 2: cornflower blue
Custom Color 3: Unaltered
Custom Color 4: Unaltered
Custom Color 5: Unaltered
Custom Characteristic 1: yellow-striated
Custom Characteristic 2: yellow-striated
Custom Characteristic 3: Unaltered
Custom Characteristic 4: Unaltered
Custom Characteristic 5: Unaltered
If you wish to transfer your natural eye characteristic and eye color to the Custom 1 slots, simply RAISE the mask.  Be warned, it will erase the customization there.

The invar razor is currently set to disfigure with an angular scar underneath the collarbone.  The razor is clean.  The razor is sharp.
The razor can not be worn.
Analysis of a reinforced invar razor indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a scarring razor.  It can be used to scar yourself or another who is joined to you.  Scarring razors require some first aid training to use, the better you are, the more efficient you'll be.  The razor must be cleansed and sharpened to get the most of out the item, but over time, the razor will break apart, unless you obtain a special one that will never dull.

Scars will go in the distinguishing mark area of your features, and are permanent.  You will be prompted as to what it will replace.  If something is temporarily altering your features, you will need to remove or stop whatever it is before being scarred.  There is a short cooldown period in between uses to prevent overzealous scarring.
Scar Selection:

To choose how you scar, you must PUSH to select what you'd like to change and PULL to cycle through the choices available.  Custom scars are possible to get from a merchant who can work on the razors.  To select a custom scar, you'd need to TURN the razor.
Scarring Yourself:
In order to scar yourself, you just need to POINT it at yourself.
Scarring Others:
To scar others, they must be following you.  Once grouped, you simply POINT the razor at them and they will need to APPROVE it.  Once approved, they will be scarred.
Razor Maintenance:
Razors need to be cleansed after they are used, and sharpened when they start to dull.  There are several different ways to clean the razor.  Some come with other effects.
The invar razor will cost 50,000 coins.

Alterations are permitted to the base description following the 15/15/15 rule in ALTER 2, provided that it continues to make sense that the contents would be identifiable without looking inside.
It can hold a maximum of 20 items.  PUT items in to store them.  SHAKE the jar to get them back out.
The glass jar will cost 225,000 coins.

Analysis of a folded plum canvas tent indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a standard tent and will be knocked down by hostile creatures.  The owner may have one guest.

The standing version of the tent may be altered with a long description, but not a show.  The description must include "canvas tent."  The interior of the tent may be changed by rare merchants as a delayed service, or for Premium Points via Sadie Scroll.
Exterior:
a peaked rich plum-hued canvas tent emblazoned in stylized silver dragons
Interior:
[Brodega's Tent]
The interior of the tent is pretty sparse.  Bits of sand and dirt are scattered across the ground.  The scent of mildew permeates the air.

The room interior can be altered to reference a placed lantern, bedroll, storage container, trash can, or scent.  If not referenced, additional sentences will be appended to display them.  There is a 511 character limit total on the room descriptions.  Any items not referenced will show in the room as "You also see...".  The items will not be linked in the room description; you can ANALYZE inside the tent to see the items that are placed there to interact with.
You can STAND the tent to pitch it, and FOLD it to take it down.  You can also CLEAN, LEAN, or KNOCK on the tent.
PLACE the following items in your tent to store or remove them from the room:
* Perfume bottles, oil lamps and oils, or incense to impart a temporary fragrance to the tent.  The scent is currently: mildew
* One General Store lantern or torch, which can then be lit to light the room: None.
* One General Store bedroll; meditation mat; prayer rug; or folding chair:  None.
* One Pup Tent Storage Container: None.
PROD the tent flap to allow open access to the tent.
This tent can be lightened by one pound until it reaches two pounds.
The plum canvas tent will cost 3,000,000 coins.

raw: The lid of this pine box has been exquisitely painted, depicting dramatic colorful scenery from one corner to the other.  Two of the four sides are adorned with large, rounded enamel moons, one faintly luminescent, while the other is tinted in hazy dark hues.  A half-moon, painted in muted yellow tones, is depicted on a third side.  In elegant script, the words "Lornon" and "Liabo" have been inked beneath each of the orbs, while no lettering exists beneath the half-moon.  The Lornon moon is completely flush with the side of the box.
It is estimated that a darkened pine box can store a very small amount with enough space for one item.
The box can not be worn.
Analysis of a darkened pine box indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This pine box (also known as an Arkati Box) can have either a short or a long description, but cannot support a show, as one already exists.  It must also remain some kind of container that would have a lid/top.  The box is currently at Tier 2 and has the following verbs available: PUSH, POKE, TOUCH, TURN, RUB, CLEAN, GAZE, OPEN, CLOSE, LOOK and PUT.  Though the box may not be unlocked further, if you win a raffle version, you could opt to have your current box adjusted to the raffle tier.  Your box is aligned to: Lornon.  This was first released at Ebon Gate 2014 in Go Figure, owned by Bisha.
Try as you might, you cannot get a good sense of whether or not the box's pockets could get any deeper, but you can tell that the box is as light as it can get.
The pine box will cost 200,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 30,000 silvers.
It is a container with a maximum interior capacity of 1 pound with room for one item.
It is magic resistant.
It is predominantly crafted of wood.
It has a temporarily unlocked loresong by Nytengale.

---- WerePuppy Toy ----
---- General Script Information ----
This is a toy that is well suited to a WerePuppy, either yours or someone else's!
PLAY with a puppy with this toy in either hand.
This toy can have a different description when covered in saliva or ectoplasm after being played with.
CLEAN the toy to remove the saliva/ectoplasm and get it back to new.
You can do the following with this toy: CLEAN, WAVE (targeted/untargeted), TOSS/THROW, EAT.
---- Alteration Guidelines ----
* Alterations to the 15/15/15, long and show are fine.
* This toy can have separate descriptions for both clean and dirty states.
* When changing the 'dirty' description, keep in mind you can include a placeholder to insert the substance the toy is coated in (either saliva or ectoplasm).
* Any merchant should be able to change the type of toy, as well, to match the description.
IE, changing a ball to be a rope.
---- Current Settings ----
This toy is setup to be a ball.
NOTE: Balls should be assumed to be made out of twine/rope, wood, bone, layered fabric, etc.
Rubber does not exist in Elanthia.
NOTE: Possible types of toys include balls, tug ropes, stuffed toys or bones/antlers.
Clean 15/15/15: a smooth,wooden,eyeball
Dirty 15/15/15: a smooth,wooden,eyeball
Dirty Long Description: a smooth wooden eyeball covered in a thin layer of (saliva/ectoplasm)

Slightly longer than conventional daggers, the longknife has a bloodgroove that stretches from the silver crossguard to within a thumb's width of the blade's tip.  Highly reflective, silvery runes dance across the white-streaked mithril blade, the intricacies of their creation clear in the ambient light.  A large sphere of black dreamstone is fitted into the pommel as a counterweight, while the hilt is partially hidden in a woven grip of moonlight silver and ebon suede.  It has a small enchanter's glyph.  A strange necrotic haze radiates from the longknife.  A strong aura of holy light radiates from the longknife.
There appears to be something written on it.
In the Common language, it reads:
Bliss is found in sleep and dreams.
Analysis of a silver-edged mithril longknife indicates the creator has provided the following information:

The softest of whispers tickles your ears, and you feel as though the mithril longknife is trying to communicate with you.  "I'm sorry, " it says, "but I can not allow you to use this blade.  However, if you seek out the path of light and right, then perhaps one day I can aid you."
You realize that due to your CONVERT status that you will never be able to fully utilize this mithril longknife.
The mithril longknife will cost 999,999,900 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 12,600,000 silvers.
It is predominantly crafted of mithril.
It has been ensorcelled 5 times.
It has been sanctified 5 times.  It has permanent Holy Fire flares.
It may be enchanted up to a bonus of 40 by a wizard and was last enchanted by Kylishatary.
It is an intricate project (501 difficulty) for an adventurer to modify.
It has a permanently unlocked loresong by Luxelle.

However certain merchants may be willing to change which "type" you have, changing what it pretends to be when you wear it.  The options are: Earring, Necklace, Ring, and Bracelet. items.name: a silver bell-trimmed azure gossamer veil skirt

raw: The long, flowing skirt is made of panels of fine silk that fall into layers of graceful folds.  The hem is fringed with silken tassels ending in dozens of tiny delicate silver bells.
Analysis of a silver bell-trimmed azure gossamer veil skirt indicates the creator has provided the following information:

You get a strong sense that the skirt can be altered by any merchant, but there are many restrictions.  Only the base and long description can be altered, since the SHOW cannot be changed or removed.  Any base or long alterations must take into account that the item is long and flowy, made primarily of silk, and is fringed with silken tassels that end in bells.  The bells can be golden or silver - depending on what you'd like - as long as the merchant is willing to modify them.
Currently, you are able to CLEAN, PULL, RUB, SLAP, TOSS, SHAKE, PLUCK, WAVE, TURN, RAISE, KICK, and NUDGE the skirt.
The bell-trimmed skirt will cost 1,000,000 coins.

items.name: an earthen brown eisenruck with an invar frame

raw: This brown eisenruck appears to be a rigid-sided, back-worn container similar to a backpack.  Despite its sturdy, utilitarian design, gaps between its panels provide a glimpse of clockwork enhancements, and small louvered vents are set into several of the eisenruck's flat surfaces.  The eisenruck's left strap bears a bronze plate with no gem sockets.
It is estimated that an earthen brown eisenruck with an invar frame can store a significant amount with enough space for any number of items.
Analysis of an earthen brown eisenruck with an invar frame indicates the creator has provided the following information:

Looking over the eisenruck and inspecting its finer details, you realize that it will always need to be "a/n (whatever)/(whatever)/eisenruck", so the item's article and adjective CAN be changed, but "eisenruck" cannot.
To insert a gem into the eisenruck, you must be wearing the eisenruck and holding a gem in one hand, then PUSH eisenruck.
Note 1:  The eisenruck must be worn continuously for a minimum of one day before any of its gem-eating abilities will function.
Note 2:  When you LOOK at your eisenruck, if a socket is described as "open," then it is ready to have a gem inserted into it.  If a socket is described as "closed," then it is in cooldown.

Note 3:  Although it is not required by the script, this eisenruck is designed to interact with the Gnomish Repair System, which enables the wearer of a scripted Gnomish Repair Belt to alter this eisenruck's appearance to any of several "damaged" descriptions which are pre-stored in the eisenruck's extra text fields.  Please keep that in mind if you request an alteration for this item.  The "damaged" description texts may also need to be changed by the merchant in order to reflect the changes of your alteration.

If you were to play with the brown eisenruck, then you'd find that you can analyze, wear, remove, pinch, poke, and push it.  PUSH won't do anything if the eisenruck has no gem sockets "unlocked" or added.
This is a Tier 0 eisenruck, which has not been unlocked at all and is still as sold OTS.  It has four gem tiers in total.
This eisenruck is sold OTS with no gem tier unlocked.
The eisenruck contains a lining that can be PULLed out: a pearl-clasped invar mesh lining
The lining may be altered, but it must be consistent with a mesh metal, and the noun must remain "lining."
Lining Tier: 1 / 3
SCRIPT NAME:  Gem-eater Eisenruck

items.name: a cloakwing moth greatcloak of tenebrous spidersilk

raw: Resembling an illuminated cloakwing tenebrous moth, the spidersilk of the greatcloak features sunny yellow speckles festooned along the edges of the tenebrous forewings and ghost white sprinkles centered on the citrine hindwings.  Tiny caterpillars are embroidered along the edges of the greatcloak.  The greatcloak's interior has several pockets, ties, and straps to hide items away.
It is estimated that a cloakwing moth greatcloak of tenebrous spidersilk can store a significant amount with enough space for any number of items.
Analysis of a cloakwing moth greatcloak of tenebrous spidersilk indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Moth Cloaks ~*~
This greatcloak is a butterfly/moth cloak with several randomizing points to create multiple unique looks with a single PUSH.  It is Tier 1 out of 5, and it is set to the moth setting.
Utilities:
* PUSH - replaces your randomized look
Unlocked Fluff Verbs:  None.  This is an off-the-shelf greatcloak.
Alterations:
* Base:  must be simple, as it carries across all looks.  The noun must be in the hooded cloak family.
* Material:  must be a type of cloth.  This carries across all looks.
* Colors cannot be referenced in the base or material fields, as colors change based on the settings.
* Custom settings:  The alter points must be provided in this specific order:

** "butterfly adjective^wingtype^forewing color^forewing marking^forewing marking color^forewing marking location^hindwing color^hindwing marking^hinding marking color^hindwing markinglocation^special*moth adjective^wingtype^forewing color^forewing marking^forewing marking color^forewing marking location^hindwing color^hindwing marking^hinding marking color^hindwing marking location^special
** The total character count must be 511 or less
** Moth/Butterfly Adjective alter point must be 15 characters or less.  No a/an needed.
** See the wiki for in-depth information and examples at https://gswiki.play.net/Moth_Cloak
* Custom Look 1 (Butterfly):  You can provide a SHOW for your custom setting.  It cannot contradict the alter points selected for the custom settings.
* Custom Look 2 (Moth):  Same as butterfly, but for the moth version.

* Doing a custom setting is 1 alteration service, as is each custom look (so a custom setting, butterfly look, and moth look are 3 separate alterations.  This is because each one is fairly intricate).
* The base/material can be done by a merchant separately or at the same time as one of the custom alterations.
*  It is up to the individual merchant if they wish to work on these items.
Current Settings:

pearlescent^longwing^scarlet^shield-shaped markings^rowan^tipping the far edge of the^cerulean^waves^maroon^along the lower edge of the^Tiny constellations are embroidered along the greatcloak's hood.*illuminated^cloakwing^tenebrous^speckles^sunny yellow^festooned along the edges of the^citrine^sprinkles^ghost white^centered on the^Tiny caterpillars are embroidered along the edges of the greatcloak.
~*~End Custom Analyze~*~
The spidersilk greatcloak will cost 10,000,000 coins.

~Bone Shaman Clothing~
Bone-adorned shamanistic clothing with customizable adornments.
This clothing can work in tandem with Bone Shaman Cloaks, but they also work well on their own.
Alterations to this are fine as long as you heed the restrictions below.
~Restrictions~
* Item MUST indicate it is decorated with some sort of bone in the 15/15/15, long or show.
* Bone adornment CAN be:
- Bones/bone fragments
- Claws/talons
- Teeth/fangs
- Beaks
- Skulls (small)
- Horn/antler pieces
* Bone adornment can NOT be:
- Specific to a race (NO elven finger bones, for example)
- An entire skeleton
- Large bones/skulls
* Currently works with ONLY:
- Leg-worn [skirts, pants, etc.]
- Torso-worn (robes, dresses, shirts, etc.)
- Front-worn (bodices, vests, tabards, etc.)
~Item Information~
This item is setup for bodice messaging.
This item is currently Tier 1 of 2.  (Off the Shelf)
At this tier, you have access to the following actions: WEAR, REMOVE, SHAKE, POUND.
This item has a custom adornment: slivers of bone

This is a standard tent and will be knocked down by hostile creatures.  The owner may have one guest.

The standing version of the tent may be altered with a long description, but not a show.  The description must include "canvas tent."  The interior of the tent may be changed by rare merchants as a delayed service, or for Premium Points via Sadie Scroll.
Exterior:
a beige canvas tent draped with netting
Interior:
[Brodega's Tent]
The interior of the tent is pretty sparse.  Bits of sand and dirt are scattered across the ground.  The scent of mildew permeates the air.

The room interior can be altered to reference a placed lantern, bedroll, storage container, trash can, or scent.  If not referenced, additional sentences will be appended to display them.  There is a 511 character limit total on the room descriptions.  Any items not referenced will show in the room as "You also see...".  The items will not be linked in the room description; you can ANALYZE inside the tent to see the items that are placed there to interact with.
You can STAND the tent to pitch it, and FOLD it to take it down.  You can also CLEAN, LEAN, or KNOCK on the tent.
PLACE the following items in your tent to store or remove them from the room:
* Perfume bottles, oil lamps and oils, or incense to impart a temporary fragrance to the tent.  The scent is currently: mildew
* One General Store lantern or torch, which can then be lit to light the room: None.
* One General Store bedroll; meditation mat; prayer rug; or folding chair:  None.
* One Pup Tent Storage Container: None.
PROD the tent flap to allow open access to the tent.

items.name: an intricately carved mossbark staff cradling an obsidian orb

raw: Firmly wedged at the top of the length of the mossbark is a translucent obsidian orb.  It has a small enchanter's glyph.  A strong aura of holy light radiates from the staff.
Analysis of an intricately carved mossbark staff cradling an obsidian orb indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is the Globus Elanthias staff, or more commonly the Soul Eater staff.  It has forlorn shades as its flare type.  There is a orb made of translucent obsidian that is wedged into the top of the length of mossbark, and it can be customized in the following way:
Globe Type: Globe, Orb, Sphere, Spheroid, Ball, Skull
Globe Material: Glaesine, Glass, Crystalline, Obsidian, Clear Gemstone

An intricately carved mossbark staff cradling an obsidian orb can be altered with a long or a show description.  If it has a long description, then it will always have a show of "Firmly wedged at the top of the length of mossbark is a translucent obsidian orb."  However, if it does not have a show description, then it will always have a show of "Sinew and rawhide bind the top of the length of mossbark to create a cradle for a translucent obsidian orb that rests within it."  If you are designing your own show, you may ask your alterer to include how the orb is wedged into the staff, but it must always be at the top.
It is currently 4 of 4 Tiers.
With the following verbs available: Attend*, Bow, Chuckle, Clean, Gaze**, Greet, Nudge, Point, Prod, Raise, Rub***, Tap****, and Wave
You have unlocked the Soul Eating feature, which will charge your staff.  You can only charge it with creatures that you can learn from.  Some creatures will give more charges than others.
The staff currently has 39 charges out of 200 stored in it.

Your carved staff will produce a second flare during combat that costs 15 charges at activation.  This option can be toggled off using PROD. (Please note, second flare is an additional seed added to the damage, not unique messaging.
* This is a feature change (hair) option that will last 1 hour and cost 5 charges to activate.
** This is a feature change (eyes) option that will last 1 hour and cost 5 charges to activate.
*** This is a feature change (unique) option that will last 1 hour and cost 5 charges to activate.

**** Soul Storm - This allows for you to cause the collected souls to fly out of your staff to do damage to the surrounding creatures/people and costs 50 charges to activate with a 1 hour cool down.  ~*~ Please note, if done in town you will be sent to jail.  ~*~
Your cool down timer has expired and is ready for use.
This staff has a Custom Flare Message script - messaging is not available.
The carved staff will cost 50,000,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 48,650,000 silvers.
It is predominantly crafted of mossbark.
It has been sanctified 3 times.
It may be enchanted up to a bonus of 35 by a wizard and was last enchanted by Vardac.
It is a complicated project (353 difficulty) for an adventurer to modify.
It has some unknown (scripted) benefit.
It has a permanently unlocked loresong by Xavanna.
details.flare: the power of a dark substance

raw: The ring appears to be made of interleaved gold and brass.  It is difficult to tell if the gold is real without damaging the ring itself.  The pattern made by the two metals seems to have no purpose and almost appears to shift into new designs as you move it about in your hand.  Along the outer edge of the ring, tiny stylized suns appear to have been etched upon its surface.  Despite the shifting patterns of the ring, the suns appear fixed in place, almost as if they were waiting for something.
The sun-etched gold ring will cost 35,000 coins.

Analysis of a clouded grey myrtlewood ring indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a Ghule ring (modern-style).

You get the sense that this ring can be altered, though there are some restrictions.  Any merchant can change its base and long description, but it must remain a ring of some kind.  The only elements of its show description that can be altered are the material of the ring and the COLOR of 'glow' that the gem on it is giving off.

If altering the glow color: it must be a COLOR.  Stick to the actual hue/shade (not other things that it could be doing, like glowing, scintillating, or pulsing, for example), and specifically avoid "deep" in the color and "-hued" to prevent double wording in some messaging (-colored, etc. is fine).  Avoid going overboard on modifiers.
Your ring is currently set to the following color:  clouded grey.
Currently you are able to STARE/PEER/GAZE at the ring.  This ring may be unlocked further (to allow for more color options) within special, rare circumstances.
The myrtlewood ring will cost 2,000,000 coins.

items.name: a glossy ebon shroud with brilliant white stitching

raw: It is estimated that a glossy ebon shroud with brilliant white stitching can store a medium amount with enough space for several items of very small size.
Analysis of a glossy ebon shroud with brilliant white stitching indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is an "Imbued Shroud," and it contains a dark elf assassin, with a venomous expression on his face.
The spirit can NOT be changed or altered in any way.
The whispers from the spirit contained within your shroud currently have a chance of being heard by others in the same room.  To toggle this off, RUB your shroud.

The spirit can occasionally be glimpsed by others when the shroud is worn and will WHISPER things to the wearer, and at higher unlock tiers those whispers can be heard by others in the room.  When fully unlocked, this ebon shroud has the ability to unleash a wave attack a certain number of times per day.
Alteration Information:

This ebon shroud must remain a "shroud" and must always remain a cloth garment of very high quality, thus nothing even remotely tattered, torn, shabby, ragged, stained, etc.  Aside from that, there are no restrictions.  The shroud can handle both long and show descriptions with no trouble.
This shroud is currently Tier 4 out of a maximum of 4 Tiers.
This shroud has the following actions available: WEAR, REMOVE, PULL, PUSH, RUB, SMELL, TWIST, and SHAKE.
At this Tier, the shroud has Spirit Shriek unlocked.
This shroud currently has 1 uses of Spirit Shriek left.
This shroud refills to its maximum of 1 uses of Spirit Shriek every day.
This shroud is unlocked for Greater Spirit Shriek.
This shroud is restricted, and can only be worn by a Ranger.
The ebon shroud will cost 20,000,000 coins.

items.name: some grey elesine sandals with twisted indigo suede ties

raw: While the crisscrossing main straps, heel risers, and heel leashes of the sandals are made of lustrous light grey elesine, the soles and footbed are a dull-finished pewter leather.  Woven along the strips of elesine of the upper straps and heel leash are thin cords of indigo suede that extend beyond the base structure of the sandal to serve as ties.  The dye work on the suede is inconsistent, ranging from light blue to dark and back again, like the moonlight-dappled waves of a nighttime sea.
It is estimated that some grey elesine sandals with twisted indigo suede ties can store a very small amount with enough space for one item of very small size.
You can tell that the sandals are as light as they can get, but you might be able to have a talented merchant deepen their pockets for you.
The grey elesine sandals will cost 250,000 coins.

items.name: a scarred dark leather cape woven with vaalin thread

raw: A scarred dark leather cape woven with vaalin thread has a thick amber bangle fitted into the left corner where the fabric has been stitched to form a sleeve, while the right corner has a spherical platinum brooch encircled by sapphire chips pinned to it.
It is estimated that a scarred dark leather cape woven with vaalin thread can store a huge amount with enough space for any number of items.
Analysis of a scarred dark leather cape woven with vaalin thread indicates the creator has provided the following information:

A scarred dark leather cape woven with vaalin thread is part of the Shield Cape Collection, which was purchased at Duskruin in the shop "Shield Thyself".  It is a passive defense item that has a chance to block an incoming blow.  The chance increases with each tier that is unlocked.  If the wearer has no weapons in his hands, no shield/runestaff, or is using a bow/crossbow, then he gets the full benefit of the cape.  Otherwise the chance is halved.
Its current status is OTS and that gives it access to the following verbs: pull (removes brooch), push (adds brooch), remove, turn (removes bangle), twist (adds bangle), wear
To upgrade its abilities, you will need to obtain an unlock certificate.

Brooch Data: (Default Brooch) A spherical platinum brooch encircled by sapphire chips can be changed by using PULL to remove the brooch and PUSH to add a new one.  Please note, only specialized brooches will work.  Once your brooch is upgraded from the default piece, it unlocks a 50% chance to retain a charge within it for each successful block.  When the brooch reaches 10 charges, it automatically flares and absorbs all of the charges.

Bangle Data: (Default Bangle) A thick amber bangle can be changed by using TURN to remove the bangle and TWIST to add a new one.  Please note, only specialized bangles will work.  Once your bangle is upgraded from the default piece, it provides an additional 25% chance to absorb a charge.  It will not provide this additional percentage chance if the brooch is not upgraded.  Additionally, bangles can have special unlocks to change the flare type.

You may alter a scarred dark leather cape woven with vaalin thread freely providing it does not contradict the messaging.  The cape can never be a jacket, a longcoat, a coat, a robe, or any similar nouns based on its design.  Nor will it ever have a hood.  This garment will attach at the left wrist by a thick amber bangle, slide over the arm and across the left shoulder.  It will then dip down the back (under wings for the Aelotoi), under the right arm, and can be pulled across the chest so that it is pinned at the left shoulder with a spherical platinum brooch encircled by sapphire chips.
The dark leather cape will cost 2,000,000 coins.

Analysis of a faenor nugget indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Your nugget is used to unlock the potential of things held in your other hand or on your person.
A faenor nugget grants the ability to transmute an eligible enhancive armament into a jewelry item.
DETAILS:
> Eligible armaments include armor, weapons, shields, armor accessories, and UCS gloves/boots.
> The armament must be unscripted.  Looted feras items are permitted.
> In most cases, the resulting jewelry item is "a/an/some <material> <noun>."
> Wooden belts will be "a/an <material>-linked belt."
> Enhancive, attunement, and loresong recall properties will transfer.
> The source item will be destroyed.
> Nouns are dictated by the selected worn location for the transmute.
> Use LOOK to view the current setting.
> Use TURN [to #] to toggle to the next or a specific worn location.  Currently: PIN
(1) pin  [pin]           (7)  arms   [armbands]
(2) head [crown]         (8)  wrist  [bracelet]
(3) hair [barrette]      (9)  finger [ring]
(4) ear  [earring]       (10) waist  [belt]
(5) ears [earrings]      (11) ankle  [anklet]
(6) neck [necklace]
You need only RAISE your nugget while holding a compatible item in your other hand or on your person.
Your nugget may not be altered or changed in any way.
The faenor nugget will cost 30,000,000 coins.

items.name: a prismatic crystal jar with a glass-inset lid

raw: Constructed of thick prismatic crystal, this jar is well made and sturdy.  A glass-paned lid secures the top, while a webbing of interlaced twine wraps around the sides and bottom to secure it into a belt loop.  Murky liquid of an indeterminate color fills the jar, making it difficult to see exact details of what's inside.
Analysis of a prismatic crystal jar with a glass-inset lid indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~Bloodletting Leech Jar~
This jar holds leeches meant for bloodletting.
Currently, this jar can only produce 1 leech daily.
Today, you've pulled 0 leeches.
You will find the following will do something special on this jar:  WEAR, REMOVE, TURN, PULL
You can use INSPECT to see what types of leeches are available.
~Alterations~
The 15/15/15 and long description of this jar can be changed freely.  A show is not possible.
Please keep in mind that the noun can change, but should be something feasible to have a lid and be made of glass (jar, bottle, etc.)
Special merchants can improve your jar in the following ways:
* Add more potential leech designs that can be PULLed. (Premade)
* Add a completely custom leech design that can be PULLed.
* Increase the amount of leeches able to be PULLed daily to a max of 3.
~Customization~
* Material Color and Type: prismatic crystal
Note: materials can only be glass, crystal or glaes.
Description of the color should not make it seem completely opaque, as messaging indicates being able to see the liquid inside.
NOTE: If using glaes, do NOT make it transparent.  It should be colored like stained glass.
* Lid: glass-paned lid
Note: this should be a 'lid' or 'top' of some sort.
* Wrapping Material: twine
This is the interwoven netting wrapping/encasing the jar.
The crystal jar will cost 1,000,000 coins.

items.name: a snow white kaajkur bordered by a platinum-belled red velvet ribbon

raw: Crafted in the Finnian style and bedecked with platinum bells, the kaajkur bears a low-rise pommel and stirrups that hang down at a middling length.
The kaajkur can not be worn.
Analysis of a snow white kaajkur bordered by a platinum-belled red velvet ribbon indicates the creator has provided the following information:
--------- VIEW FROM A STAG SADDLES - ANALYZE INFO  ---------
This kaajkur is a View From a Stag saddle meant for use with "cervid" mounts.
Verb Sets active on this kaajkur:
*Verb Set 1:  DROP/PUT, GET, MOUNT (with styles), and DISMOUNT (with styles).
MOUNT styles -- MOUNT {STYLE} {target cervid} -- that are valid for this kaajkur's current setup are:  RIGHT; LEFT; POMMEL; MANE; JUMP; GRACE-L; GRACE-R
DISMOUNT styles -- DISMOUNT {STYLE} -- that are valid for this kaajkur's current setup are:  POMMEL; MANE, JUMP, SLIDE, GRACE-L, GRACE-R

The kaajkur can have various accessories added to it, if they were made specifically for a kaajkur:  a saddle pad, a saddle blanket, and either bells or trim.  If you have an accessory, you will need to hold both items and SLAP the saddle to add it; to remove an accessory, PRY for bells/trim, and PINCH or PINCH KAAJKUR WITH {PAD|BLANKET} for pad/blanket.  Some accessories change the long description.  This kaajkur currently has the following accessories attached:
*bell item (platinum bells)
--------- ALTERATION INFORMATION ---------

The noun cannot change.  So what can you do?  Any merchant may alter the article, adjective, and/or long description of the kaajkur.  They can also add a show description that will append to the hard-coded LOOK.  All alterations must be in keeping with the saddle's style (see below).  It is also recommended that you avoid show descriptions that rely on the long description being present because accessories can temporarily change the long description.
Note that some aspects of the LOOK are hard-coded (such as the length of the stirrups) and cannot currently be modified by a merchant.

This saddle's style (which is not currently eligible to be changed to another style) is set to kaajkur (Finnian).  For alteration purposes, keep the following in mind:  Its pommel is low-rise (doesn't really jut up vertically), and the cantle is what you'd expect from a "normal" saddle.  The stirrups are loose (no flaps).  It utilizes a billet and buckle girth type system for saddling.  It will usually include a pad or not use anything underneath at all.  It is somewhat light compared to other saddle styles.
The snow white kaajkur will cost 1,000,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 0 silvers.
It has a temporarily unlocked loresong by Trace.

raw: You notice that the crimson marble teabowl can hold liquids.
The teabowl can not be worn.
Analysis of a bright crimson marble teabowl indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a drink container.
Erithi Teabowls for General and Funeral Use
This teabowl is set for general usage.

This is a drink container specifically for teabowls.  Noun must remain teabowl, but the rest of the base can be altered, and it supports a long and a show.  In addition, if it is designed after a dai-specific funeral teabowl per the erithi funeral document, the dai may be set by a merchant to add extra flavor to some of the messaging.  You could also request a custom accent/inlay like "amethyst and ivory inlay" as long as it does not contradict the teabowl's current look.
The current custom accent is:  starveil toadstool inlay.
It is tier 1 of 2 and has the following fluff traps:  ATTEND, RAISE, and TOUCH.
Several fluff traps have different messaging depending on if it is general or funeral use.  POKE cycles between general and funeral settings.

There may, from time to time, be a rare opportunity to win a custom fluff message for use with your teabowl as well.  It activates off HUG and must make sense if the teabowl has liquid or is empty.  You can have a first person, third person if not hidden/invisible, and third person if hidden/invisible.  You must be holding it for it to work, but the actual text doesn't have to have anything to do with HUG; that is just the activator.  This is a delayed service requiring QC.
The crimson marble teabowl will cost 55,000 coins.

Analysis of a coat-style lilac velvet overgown indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Illegal Alteration Clothing Line (IACLs) ~*~

This item can have different descriptions when held and worn.  Wait!  What??  That's right, you can now have a tight bodice, low-rise pants, or maybe a long cloak that actually drags on the ground.  Keep in mind that normal alteration rules may still apply based on merchant personalities and general good taste.
Verbs:  ATTEND, REMOVE, RUB and WEAR
Alteration Guidelines:
* You can have a base, long, and show
* Base:  the same for both worn and unworn
* Long:  not required for unworn (unless you want a show) but required for worn
* Show:  not required, but if you have it, it will be the same for worn and unworn, and you will need a long for unworn too
* DISALLOWED:  Anything that references exposed skin is not allowed (so no shoulder-baring shirts or tight pants revealing a toned abdomen, for example)
* Overly Risque Items:  This script is not meant to get around any policies on overly risque items.  The merchant has final say on this.
This item has the following worn description:
a coat-style lilac velvet overgown cinched half-way down the front

This is a Fashionable Jacket, first released at Ebon Gate 2009.  It may be altered, but must remain a fancy/stylish jacket (no holes, tears, stains, etc.) and any alterations should not contradict that it has both buttons and pockets.
A merchant can customize the look of the buttons.  Please limit this to one or two words.
Current setting: filigree
VERBS:  CLOSE, OPEN, PUSH, TAP
The leather jacket will cost 250,000 coins.

Analysis of a tea green leather valise indicates the item is free from merchant alteration restrictions.

It is estimated that a fan-bustled jacquard corset belt can store a very small amount with enough space for a couple of items of very small size.
Analysis of a fan-bustled jacquard corset belt indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This belt is a "Teacup Belt" and will only hold teacups and saucers.  Alterations are fine, but it must remain some sort of belt or waist-cincher.  No long descriptions.  The long description of the belt will change when you PUT a teacup into it.  If you don't want the teacup to be shown on the belt, use PROD to revert it back to its 15/15/15 description.
You may customize the following fields:
Fabric = dark jacquard
<Material/Type> Straps = jade-buckled leather straps
The jacquard corset belt has not been unlocked.  A talented merchant could improve it.
This item may not have its pockets deepened.
The jacquard corset belt will cost 200,000 coins.
Analysis of a ram horn headdress indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The headdress has four custom feature settings.  It can't have anymore.
When adding custom feature settings, it will be just like altering your hair quirk (or unique line if you're bald).  An example would be:
tucked under a ram horn headdress, which is tightly knotted in the back.
He has a ram horn headdress covering his bald head.
with a ram horn headdress placed at the crown of his head.
He has a ram horn headdress placed at the crown of his bald head.

Please note, that if you have the custom settings made for someone bald, it won't look right for someone with hair, and vice versa.  You also can't wear this with another hair quirk/unique field altering item to change your features.  This item isn't limited to just bandana-type items, it can also be a crown, tiara, visored helm, or something similar.
Custom feature 1: woven with dried flowers and wound about a headdress of spiraling gilded ram horns
Custom feature 2: thinly braided into a fine web suspended from a headdress of pastel-painted ram horns
Custom feature 3: with a gilded lavender horn headdress peeking out from a riot of curls
Custom feature 4: plaited in dual coils around a gilded rose headdress of oversized ram horns
The horn headdress will cost 4,000,000 coins.

items.name: a pitch black-leafed cigar with a cobalt moon-stamped band

raw: The black-leafed cigar is unlit.
There appears to be something written on it.
Fine script on the band reads, "Wild Ebony."
You determine that you could hold a lit cigar in your mouth for a few minutes.
Analysis of a pitch black-leafed cigar with a cobalt moon-stamped band indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a smokeable cigar.  To smoke the cigar, you must light it, most commonly with a match.  You can SMELL the cigar.  While lit, you can KNOCK, TAP or PULL the cigar.  After drawing a puff, you could EXHALE the cigar AT someone or something to blow smoke at them.  It can be EXTINGUISHed to stop smoking before it burns out.
It has a bitter chicory, spicy hops, and valerian root blend scent.
When smoked, the smoker will smell like Black Wendigo tobacco, chicory, hops, and valerian root.
This cigar could be held in your teeth for a few minutes.
You estimate that the cigar could burn for another thirty minutes or so.
The black-leafed cigar will cost 100,000 coins.

sign: Written on a key-wreathed aged bronze sign:

items.name: a storm grey worsted tweed overcoat draped with a flared lapelled capelet

raw: A sharply flared collar affixed with a gear-worked clasp secures a short capelet that drapes over the top half of this handsomely crafted overcoat of fastidiously woven worsted wool dyed a storm grey hue. Delicate vertical stripings of silver thread relieve the monotony of grey and create a subtle sheen as the light plays off their lengths. The loose folds of the fabric, designed to drape about the form in a cloak-like fashion, create sleeveless holes beneath the capelet to allow the arms free movement.
It is estimated that a storm grey worsted tweed overcoat draped with a flared lapelled capelet can store a gigantic amount with enough space for any number of items.
Analysis of a storm grey worsted tweed overcoat draped with a flared lapelled capelet indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a Peretta Cloak.  A storm grey worsted tweed overcoat draped with a flared lapelled capelet cannot be detailed to indicate that it is completely skin-tight or that it isn't long enough to "billow up" in certain situations, but it is otherwise able to be altered, so long as it remains a cloak or cloak-like item.

The a storm grey worsted tweed overcoat draped with a flared lapelled capelet can be customized in the following manner, where any talented merchant can customize the bolded sections.  Note that customizations cannot use speech:
(RUB) You fiddle with the edges of your worsted tweed overcoat in a fit of nervous energy.
(STAND) You push back your worsted tweed overcoat and immediately shift into *a suave stance.
(TOSS) With a flourish, you toss your worsted tweed overcoat over your shoulder, tilting your chin *sideways in a coquettish fashion.
(WAVE) You narrow your eyes, then suddenly step *nonchalantly forward, letting your worsted tweed overcoat billow behind you.
(WAVE - target) You narrow your eyes, then suddenly step *nonchalantly toward [target], your worsted tweed overcoat billowing out behind you.
(WAVE - sitting) Narrowing your eyes, you suddenly scoot *nonchalantly sideways, dragging your worsted tweed overcoat along the ground/floor.
(standing and sitting utilize the same customization wording)
(BOW) Pulling up the edges of your worsted tweed overcoat, you execute a stately bow.
Currently, you are able to use RUB, STAND, TURN, NUDGE, TOSS, WAVE (with target), BOW, and SPIN.  This overcoat may only be unlocked further within special, rare circumstances.
The worsted tweed overcoat will cost 20,000,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 50,000 silvers.
It is a container with a maximum interior capacity of 200 pounds with room for any number of items.
It is predominantly crafted of cloth.
It has a temporarily unlocked loresong by Erados.
Analysis of some lustrous rainbow dove filoplumes indicates the creator has provided the following information:
As you contemplate some lustrous rainbow dove filoplumes you realize that it is a small item and will never have much weight to it, therefore lightening it seems unnecessary.
You also note that certain parts of the filoplumes translate into the color of beads, haircombs, and headbands.  Currently, that is lustrous.
This filoplumes is tier 4 of 4 tiers.  You are able to use the following verbs on it:  wear, remove, weave*, pull**, attend**, pinch*, tickle, nudge*, gaze, turn*, eat, push*, and shrug.
Those verbs marked with * mean that they will create a hairstyle, and if it is marked with ** it will either remove the hairstyle or tell you what your current hairstyle looks like.

Even though the noun may be a type of feather, all hairstyles have pre-arranged ways that they will be displayed and your noun may not ever show in the hairstyle.  All feather types are allowed for the noun.

When getting these altered, feel free to express to the merchant the following information: "I would like to get the beads/haircombs/headband material/color changed to X Y Z, and I'd like to get the color/avian feather changed to A B C.
Any merchant that is comfortable with this item may unlock it to tier 2.
Lastly, the filoplumes does not require you to be wearing a hairstyle for its verbs to work.  It can be worn with other hair items and still manipulated, the same as the hair baubles.
The rainbow dove filoplumes will cost 2,000,000 coins.

The topography of Elanthia has been meticulously reproduced in relief on this copper globe.  Snow-capped mountain ranges give rise to twisting rivers that flow into lush valleys.  The oceans have a mottled greenish-blue patina, and its teak stand supports the colorful sphere.
The globe can not be worn.
Analysis of a painted copper Elanthia globe indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ Clockwork Globes ~*~

Created in 2001 by GMs Krilcan and Mitra, a painted copper Elanthia globe is a clockwork/mechanical globe.  It may be altered, but there are very specific requirements, so please be familiar with them.  It is Tier 2 of 2.
Verb Traps:
* Tier 1: poke, pull, push, and rub
* Tier 2:  fidget, lick, tickle, and turn
Alteration Guidelines:
* Any willing merchant may alter this, but unlocks require special permissions.  Cannot change type.
* In addition to the base 15/15/15, this item may have a long and/or show.  All normal ALTER rules apply.
* Each globe has its own hard-coded SHOW that prepends when you LOOK at the item, so do not contradict it.
* The noun must remain globe, and do not reference the stand in a long.
* There is a small button on the stand, and inner clockwork is mentioned in verb messagings.
* The globe and stand material customizations may have to be done at the same time if the requested service references them in some way.

* Stand Material Custom: the adjective(s) that comes before the word 'stand.'  It must be a type of material able to hold a globe.  It can be preceded by something descriptive as well (ex. pearl-inlaid mahogany).
* Globe Material Custom: the type of material, can have a modifier (ex. silver-sparked lapis).
Specific Requirements by Globe Type:
* Elanthia:  a relief globe of many colors, so the base material must support this
~*~ End Custom Analyze ~*~
The copper Elanthia globe will cost 250,000 coins.

raw: This off-white vellum looks interesting...  Perhaps you should read it.
Invoking this off-white vellum will grant you permanent access to a special method of preparing your spells.
It will provide the following phrase:

First Person:  Your golden eyes slip closed and you issue a gentle summons to the spirits of water and moisture asking that they aid you in the casting of [Spell Name].  Their power collects in the air around you and you carefully draw it inward, letting it leave trails upon your golden brown skin before sending it outward into the surrounding area.

Third Person:  Brodega's golden eyes slip closed and he issues a gentle summons to the spirits of water and moisture.  Flashing around him, the spirits respond and leave trails of their power upon his golden brown skin, which he then channels and sends outward into the surrounding area.
Hidden or Invisible:  Preceding a soft, spoken spell is a gentle summons to the spirits of water and moisture.
Specific Spell Restriction:  106

This glass jar is designed to hold small, nearly identical items -- in particular, gems, alchemy ingredients other than critter skins, etc.
Alterations are permitted to the base description following the 15/15/15 rule in ALTER 2, provided that it continues to make sense that the contents would be identifiable without looking inside.
It can hold a maximum of 20 items.  PUT items in to store them.  SHAKE the jar to get them back out.
The glass jar will cost 20,000 coins.
